metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Date Objects
JavaScript Date Objects let us work with dates:
content.html: JavaScript Date Objects let us work with dates:

content.text: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)
content.html: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)

content.code_html: const d = new Date();

content.text: Note
Date objects are static. The "clock" is not "running".
content.html: Date objects are static. The "clock" is not "running".

content.text: The computer clock is ticking, date objects are not.
content.html: The computer clock is ticking, date objects are not.

content.text: JavaScript Date Output
By default, JavaScript will use the browser's time zone and display a date as a full text string:
content.html: By default, JavaScript will use the browser's time zone and display a date as a full text string:

content.text: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)
content.html: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)

content.text: You will learn much more about how to display dates, later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn much more about how to display dates, later in this tutorial.

content.text: Creating Date Objects
Date objects are created with the new Date() constructor.
content.html: Date objects are created with the new Date() constructor.

content.text: There are 9 ways to create a new date object:
content.html: There are 9 ways to create a new date object:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
new Date()
new Date(date string)

new Date(year,month)
new Date(year,month,day)
new Date(year,month,day,hours)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds,ms)

new Date(milliseconds)

content.code:
new Date()
new Date(date string)

new Date(year,month)
new Date(year,month,day)
new Date(year,month,day,hours)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds,ms)

new Date(milliseconds)

syntax_highlighting.text:
new Date()
new Date(date string)

new Date(year,month)
new Date(year,month,day)
new Date(year,month,day,hours)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds,ms)

new Date(milliseconds)

content.code_html:
new Date()
new Date(date string)

new Date(year,month)
new Date(year,month,day)
new Date(year,month,day,hours)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds,ms)

new Date(milliseconds)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
new Date()
new Date(date string)

new Date(year,month)
new Date(year,month,day)
new Date(year,month,day,hours)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds)
new Date(year,month,day,hours,minutes,seconds,ms)

new Date(milliseconds)

content.text: JavaScript new Date()
new Date() creates a date object with the current date and time :
content.html: new Date() creates a date object with the current date and time:

content.code_html: const d = new Date();

content.text: new Date( date string )
new Date( date string ) creates a date object from a date string :
content.html: new Date(date string) creates a date object from a date string:

content.code_html: const d = new Date("October 13, 2014 11:13:00");

content.text: Date string formats are described in the next chapter.
content.html: Date string formats are described in the next chapter.

content.text: new Date( year, month, ... )
new Date( year, month, ... ) creates a date object with a specified date and time .
content.html: new Date(year, month, ...) creates a date object with a specified date and time.

content.text: 7 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, minute, second, and millisecond (in that order):
content.html: 7 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, minute, second, and millisecond (in that order):

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11, 24, 10, 33, 30, 0);

content.text: Note
JavaScript counts months from 0 to 11 :
content.html: JavaScript counts months from 0 to 11:

content.text: January = 0 .
content.html: January = 0.

content.text: December = 11 .
content.html: December = 11.

content.text: Specifying a month higher than 11, will not result in an error but add the overflow to the next year:
content.html: Specifying a month higher than 11, will not result in an error but add the overflow to the next year:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 15, 24, 10, 33, 30);

content.text: Specifying a day higher than max, will not result in an error but add the overflow to the next month:
content.html: Specifying a day higher than max, will not result in an error but add the overflow to the next month:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 5, 35, 10, 33, 30);

content.text: Using 6, 4, 3, or 2 Numbers
6 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, minute, second:
content.html: 6 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, minute, second:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11, 24, 10, 33, 30);

content.text: 5 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, and minute:
content.html: 5 numbers specify year, month, day, hour, and minute:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11, 24, 10, 33);

content.text: 4 numbers specify year, month, day, and hour:
content.html: 4 numbers specify year, month, day, and hour:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11, 24, 10);

content.text: 3 numbers specify year, month, and day:
content.html: 3 numbers specify year, month, and day:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11, 24);

content.text: 2 numbers specify year and month:
content.html: 2 numbers specify year and month:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018, 11);

content.text: You cannot omit month. If you supply only one parameter it will be treated as milliseconds.
content.html: You cannot omit month. If you supply only one parameter it will be treated as milliseconds.

content.code_html: const d = new Date(2018);

content.text: Previous Century
One and two digit years will be interpreted as 19xx:
content.html: One and two digit years will be interpreted as 19xx:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(99, 11, 24);
const d = new Date(9, 11, 24);

content.text: JavaScript Stores Dates as Milliseconds
JavaScript stores dates as number of milliseconds since January 01, 1970.
content.html: JavaScript stores dates as number of milliseconds since January 01, 1970.

content.text: Zero time is January 01, 1970 00:00:00 UTC .
content.html: Zero time is January 01, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

content.text: One day (24 hours) is 86 400 000 milliseconds.
content.html: One day (24 hours) is 86 400 000 milliseconds.

content.text: Now the time is: 1748192302605 milliseconds past January 01, 1970
content.html: Now the time is: 1748192302605 milliseconds past January 01, 1970

content.text: new Date( milliseconds )
new Date( milliseconds ) creates a new date object as milliseconds plus zero time:
content.html: new Date(milliseconds) creates a new date object as milliseconds plus zero time:

content.code_html: const d = new Date(100000000000);

content.text: Date Methods
When a date object is created, a number of methods allow you to operate on it.
content.html: When a date object is created, a number of methods allow you to operate on it.

content.text: Date methods allow you to get and set the year, month, day, hour, minute, second, and millisecond of date objects, using either local time or UTC (universal, or GMT) time.
content.html: Date methods allow you to get and set the year, month, day, hour, minute, second, and millisecond of date objects, using either local time or UTC (universal, or GMT) time.

content.text: Date methods and time zones are covered in the next chapters.
content.html: Date methods and time zones are covered in the next chapters.

content.text: Displaying Dates
JavaScript will (by default) output dates using the toString() method. This is a string representation of the date, including the time zone. The format is specified in the ECMAScript specification:
content.html: JavaScript will (by default) output dates using the toString() method. This is a string representation of the date, including the time zone. The format is specified in the ECMAScript specification:

content.code: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)
content.code_html: Sun May 25 2025 17:58:22 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)

content.text: When you display a date object in HTML, it is automatically converted to a string, with the toString() method.
content.html: When you display a date object in HTML, it is automatically converted to a string, with the toString() method.

content.code_html:
const d = new Date();
d.toString();

content.text: The toDateString() method converts a date to a more readable format:
content.html: The toDateString() method converts a date to a more readable format:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date();
d.toDateString();

content.text: The toUTCString() method converts a date to a string using the UTC standard:
content.html: The toUTCString() method converts a date to a string using the UTC standard:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date();
d.toUTCString();

content.text: The toISOString() method converts a date to a string using the ISO standard:
content.html: The toISOString() method converts a date to a string using the ISO standard:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date();
d.toISOString();

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference
For a complete Date reference, go to our:
content.html: For a complete Date reference, go to our:

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference .
content.html: Complete JavaScript Date Reference.

content.text: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.
content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What date is created with the following code: const d = new Date(2024, 10, 18); .
content.html:
What date is created with the following code:
const d = new Date(2024, 10, 18);.
